title: After BroadcastAttestation failed, beacon chain no longer synced
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description Hi After met the problem below, my beacon stopped synced ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39431803/230821930-8a27d476-5ee1-4321-9ca1-7ea92fe541ba.png) and kept resyncing. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39431803/230822098-c479532c-891a-4079-a1e8-fcd41e397584.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39431803/230822111-531a92d5-0d3e-49eb-a7b8-2f9c95b5e356.png) ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Find this problem after I updated to v4.0.1. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I closed '13000' or 30310 port TCP Income as I did not want any untrusted peers conncted to my node. The beacon command is below: beacon-chain --datadir /workdir/consensus --execution-endpoint http://127.0.0.1:8551 --grpc-gateway-host {private-ip} --p2p-local-ip 0.0.0.0 --p2p-host-ip {private-ip} --p2p-tcp-port 30310 --p2p-udp-port 30311 --grpc-gateway-port 30312 --jwt-secret /workdir/execution/jwtsecret --genesis-beacon-api-url https://beaconstate.info --checkpoint-sync-url https://beaconstate.info --bootstrap-node NmsxoQKLVXFOhp2uX6jeT0DvvDpPcU8FWMjQdR4wMuORMhpX24N1ZHCCIyg,enr:-Ku4QG-2_Md3sZIAUebGYT6g0SMskIml77l6yR-M_JXc-UdNHCmHQeOiMLbylPejyJsdAPsTHJyjJB2sYGDLe0dn8uYBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpC1MD8qAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhBLY-NyJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQORcM6e19T1T9gi7jxEZjk_sjVLGFscUNqAY9obgZaxbIN1ZHCCIyg,enr:-Ku4QPn5eVhcoF1opaFEvg1b6JNFD2rqVkHQ8HApOKK61OIcIXD127bKWgAtbwI7pnxx6cDyk_nI88TrZKQaGMZj0q0Bh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpC1MD8qAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhDayLMaJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQK2sBOLGcUb4AwuYzFuAVCaNHA-dy24UuEKkeFNgCVCsIN1ZHCCIyg,enr:-Ku4QEWzdnVtXc2Q0ZVigfCGggOVB2Vc1ZCPEc6j21NIFLODSJbvNaef1g4PxhPwl_3kax86YPheFUSLXPRs98vvYsoBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpC1MD8qAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhDZBrP2Jc2VjcDI1NmsxoQM6jr8Rb1ktLEsVcKAPa08wCsKUmvoQ8khiOl_SLozf9IN1ZHCCIyg,enr:-LK4QA8FfhaAjlb_BXsXxSfiysR7R52Nhi9JBt4F8SPssu8hdE1BXQQEtVDC3qStCW60LSO7hEsVHv5zm8_6Vnjhcn0Bh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpC1MD8qAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhAN4aBKJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQJerDhsJ-KxZ8sHySMOCmTO6sHM3iCFQ6VMvLTe948MyYN0Y3CCI4yDdWRwgiOM,enr:-LK4QKWrXTpV9T78hNG6s8AM6IO4XH9kFT91uZtFg1GcsJ6dKovDOr1jtAAFPnS2lvNltkOGA9k29BUN7lFh_sjuc9QBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpC1MD8qAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhANAdd-Jc2VjcDI1NmsxoQLQa6ai7y9PMN5hpLe5HmiJSlYzMuzP7ZhwRiwHvqNXdoN0Y3CCI4yDdWRwgiOM --p2p-priv-key /workdir/consensus/p2p-priv-key --block-batch-limit 512 --block-batch-limit-burst-factor 3 --p2p-max-peers 1000 --accept-terms-of-use --enable-debug-rpc-endpoints ## üî• Error 


I uplaod the full logs at that time , and hopfully that will help,
## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
CentOs
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
v4.0.1
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** [log-first.txt](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/files/11187476/log-first.txt)
I'm experiencing the same issue

@JAVAN000B Try running prysm without these flags:
```
--block-batch-limit 512 --block-batch-limit-burst-factor 3 
```
it appears that you have lost all your peers for some reason

@nisdas Thank you for your reply.  I  will delete those flag and test again. Just want to know why this parameters should not be modified and may cause my node lost all other peers.  I think those 2 flags will affects only when my beacon is in `initial-sync` state. When I met this problem, my node has already fully synced.  And my beacon client was continously having more than 10 outbound peers. So, this really confuesd ,why beacon chain suddenly no longer synced and kept resynced.
@JAVAN000B Do you use any of the api endpoints independently from the beacon node ?
@nisdas  U mean call beacons api ? yes, I call /eth/v1/node/health every 2s to check if beacon chain is good.

Ok you can run prysm with `--pprof` and the next time you have this issue, can you run this ?
```
http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/goroutine?debug=1
```
Then paste the output here, it looks like your node is getting stuck for some reason

@nisdas  I noticed that prysm has a new release now, should I updated to that new one? After restart my prysm with debug level, I found my prysm log had some `could not handle p2p pubsub` errors.  I find the new version fixs some Block construction and Block processing tings, are these related?
Yes, feel free to update @JAVAN000B , lets us know if it fixes your issues
FYI, we're still seeing this error after upgrading to prysm-beacon-chain to v4.0.2

@peterfo-tr Do you have more logs, or the profiles that are mentioned here ?
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/12255#issuecomment-1505088166

> @peterfo-tr Do you have more logs, or the profiles that are mentioned here ? [#12255 (comment)](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/12255#issuecomment-1505088166)

@nisdas we observed the behaviour with both v4.0.1 and v4.0.2 on both g√∂erli-prater and mainnet. Currently we are running with `--pprof` on our g√∂erli-prater deployments.

@peterfo-tr Thanks for the response, in the event that you do come across this again can you fetch a profile ?
```
curl http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/goroutine?debug=1 -o goroutine.txt
```
This would help in diagnosing the issue on our end

@nisdas Here you go. This is from the beacon node running version 4.0.2

[goroutine.txt](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/files/11248755/goroutine.txt)
Thanks @peterje-tr , do you also have the logs in the beacon node at this time ?

No problem @nisdas. Yes, here you go. A lot of repeating logs though. This is all I have:

[beacon-logs.txt](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/files/11249088/beacon-logs.txt)

Also the logs from geth if interested. It seems like something happens around time 09:30 on both beacon and geth
[geth-logs.txt](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/files/11249213/geth-logs.txt)

hey @peterje-tr , I have tried investigating it but haven't had much luck. The logs would indicate that there was an abrupt drop in network ingress for discovery, Is it possible its a networking issue on your host machine ? If you think that isn't the case, the last option would be to enable `--verbosity=trace`. However this will pretty much blow up your logs, as it will log out everything. Once you have a failure again, you can paste those logs here again.
Okay, thank you very much. We are experiencing this on multiple machines and on independent cloud networks. I've set the verbosity level to trace now :)

Thanks, @nisdas. After I updated to v4.0.2, this problem occures again. Unfortunatly, I could not get the goroutine.txt on my machine because of the cloud server provider nor open trace log : (  But this problem appears again on v4.0.2. I also notice that this problem always happens after beacon run smoothly 2 or 3 days , hopefully, this information will help.

hello @nisdas . I think I meet this problem again on my test environment . One bad thing is I forgot to open pporf on my beacon client. But I do have the trace level log and it is posted below. 
### The problem shows between 16:02:13 and 17:15:24 ###
My beacon client suddenly kept printed this error and no longer synced new payload.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39431803/233602954-f4fec718-454e-442c-963b-6367bcf3220f.png)
And then, the BroadcastAttestation error appeared.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39431803/233603580-97e91851-19e4-4b38-b1ec-dcbe7d1b4665.png)
Last, it started resyncing.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39431803/233603852-33c1f250-e103-475a-b83c-f5765ecb2948.png)

BTw, just mentioned, I am doing this experiment in order to find why sometimes the rpc request got  `i/o deadline exeed` error. This makes my peers were considerd as bad peers when the nodes my peers connected to doing revalidpeer function, as the bad respond increased.
Is there any way I can aviod this `i/o deadline exeed` error or avoid my node been banned from others because of 'bad' response?

The  log file is too large, could you provide a way I can upload?
@JAVAN000B How big is the file ? If you compress it via tar, what size do you get

[question1.zip](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/files/11302956/question1.zip)
[question2.zip](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/files/11302957/question2.zip)
[question3.zip](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/files/11302958/question3.zip)
@nisdas Im JAVAN0000B, Finally, I divided the log into 3 parts and upload

@JAVAN000B This appears to be an issue with your geth node:
```
time="2023-04-21 16:02:32" level=error msg="Could not handle p2p pubsub" error="could not process block: could not validate new payload: timeout from http.Client: received an undefined execution engine error" prefix=sync topic="/eth2/bba4da96/beacon_block/ssz_snappy"
```
This error only comes about when your execution client can't process the payload in time. It might be best to look there to see why it doesnt work

@nisdas  Thank you for your replying. As you mentioned This error only comes about when your execution client can't process the payload in time.  I checked my past logs again, but I did not opened trace level on geth. Are there any possible reasons? I am now guessing if this is caused by using a HDD. Because my node used to be disconnected by others due to `i/o deadline exeed`.
Yeah, a HDD for geth will cause issues. I would look there to see if that are any logs that might explain why geth is processing payloads so slowly.

i met the same problem

the inbound  connection drop down and after about 20 min inbound went to 0Ôºåthen beacon failed to sync

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12430046/234203076-0984192c-1a2a-4283-b01f-01718ab7a785.png)


![4943A7D9-1033-4E97-BE0A-2C3326B7A5F9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12430046/234201728-d312cfc1-3d81-4c95-b02d-3fcc6b9a7a67.png)
@MrDonalds What flags were you running with ? For the beacon node

> @MrDonalds What flags were you running with ? For the beacon node
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12430046/234222336-6afb61a1-501f-4972-a9f9-403dbe0b768f.png)

@JAVAN000B Trace logs are very noisy, so its hard to know what is the root cause here. Those logs don't say anything much, like I said earlier there possibly is an issue with your execution client from your earlier logs
